inference:
Perimeter of border = 2 x (length + width) + 2 x (length + width)
= 4(length + width)
= 4(3 x 4 + 3 x 6)
= 4(12 + 18)
= 4(30)
= 120 inches

Converting inches to feet, we get 120 ÷ 12 = 10 feet.

Final Answer: \boxed{$10$}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: After the picture is enlarged by tripling its dimensions, the dimensions become $12\times18$. After the border is added, the dimensions of the picture increase to $16\times22$ (since each side has a 2-inch border). The perimeter is $16+16+22+22=76$ inches. Since $76/12=6\frac{1}{3}$, we need $\boxed{7}$ feet of framing to go around the entire picture.

ground_truth: After the picture is enlarged by tripling its dimensions, the dimensions become $12\times18$. After the border is added, the dimensions of the picture increase to $16\times22$ (since each side has a 2-inch border). The perimeter is $16+16+22+22=76$ inches. Since $76/12=6\frac{1}{3}$, we need $\boxed{7}$ feet of framing to go around the entire picture.
